reviewText: it's about time ITV brought the best sci-fi program in years back where it belongs.  it's better than ever.  i love british television but if ITV doesn't want to continue with a season 6 and beyond, bring it to the US.  we will cherish it here.  but it must have the original connor, abby and lester!  the actors playing these characters are the heart of this excellent show and make it what it is.  here's hoping there will be many more years of primeval to come.
summary: superior sci-fi /the whole family will love it

reviewText: Like so many other good shows that get canceled before they get a chance to find their niche, Primeval was considered dead and gone after season 3. Victim of the CGI budget among other things. But there was hope, whispers, that the show would be revitalized within another year by another sponsor. Ahhh nonsense, this wasn't Star Trek 1966 saved by viewer write in campaign. The actors will go on to other things and that will be that.The Gods of British Television though declared "There Shall Be Anomalies" And a great and intriguing show is back on the air revitalized and moving forward.  Our favorites, Connor and Abby have escaped back to the Arc, the gruff boss is still their as is the well heeled head of security. There are new characters and hints to maybe even deeper secrets "New Dawn"The missus and me are glad to see a great SciFi show returned to its rightful place.
summary: Primeval returns from the anomaly of good shows unfairly cancelled.

reviewerName: E. Matsuoka "12th Level TV SciFi/Fantasy Watcher"
reviewText: I loved this show's first season, the way it played so creatively with the nonsensical premise, being serious without being too serious, never being tongue in cheek, which can often be the death of fantasy. But by this season, we sorely miss the grounding presence of Douglas Henshall. I still liked the season, it is still twice as good as almost all of the dreak that the Sy Fi channel puts out.
summary: Not as good as the first season

reviewText: Despite having a new cast every season (save a handful of regulars)  and the show has managed to keep the main themes and questions that revolve within the basic plot alive.  James Lester is still one of the most fun bosses to watch on the BBC and every now and then the show pays homage to those stars and characters that have gone before.The main mystery still hasn't been answered and Abby's still keeping her clothes on, for the most part.It's as much fun as the third season.  The story continues.

reviewText: In my opinion, this series is by far the best of it's kind to ever be produced. If you haven't seen it, I highly recommend viewing the episodes in order. If you like SCIENCE FICTION, I'll bet you're hooked by the end of season one. AMAZON.COM has them in stock. About a year ago, the producers of PRIMEVAL cancelled the series [noting that it was too expensive to produce]. That action brought protest WORLD WIDE and the series was RESURRECTED [BETTER THAN EVER]!

reviewText: I got interested in this series when it was on American television for two seasons.  When it was not picked up, I thought that was the end.  However, when I joined Amazon Prime, I found I could watch the other seasons free as part of my Amazon Prime agreement.  So I clicked on Season 3, then 4, and picked up the series.  I really like it because it is a science fiction show with humor and romance.  A great combination.

reviewText: I started watching the BBC TV series "Primeval" when it first aired. I loved it immediately. I got caught up with all the relationships of the characters, and the special effects are dazzling! The "anomaly's" look so real, like shards of glittering and glowing spinning glass. Then there are all of the creatures; most are from millions of years ago, and others are creatures from the future.
summary: A Great British Sci-Fi Series with Dinosaurs!

reviewText: I generally don't like British non-comedy TV/Movies but I was very pleasantly surprised by this (and with Being Human but that's something else entirely).  This is a very well put together, light hearted, well paced show with outstanding f/x (for TV) and solid, servicable storytelling.  It is distressing that they keep randomly dropping actors from the lead roles and that might upset younger viewers.
summary: Great show for a rainy day

reviewText: Primeval was always an interesting show, but in season three had started to get just a small bit stale. Then in season 4 after a break in the timeline ity came back with a new cast and the return of two of the origional cast members. Now although I would recommend that people should watch the origional show from the beggining to truly understand the plot, the dinnosaurs were well done, the hteary of time portals appearing was excellently done and the cast once you got used to the new people on the block this to was also excellent. I watch very little science fiction but got engaged and hookked on the show after seeing the origional season 1 and 2 in reruns, overall for the type of show it is, very entertaining and a truly good clean show.Lane
summary: Take it for what it is and enjoy
